commands.name: az durabletask taskhub create
commands.syntax:
az durabletask taskhub create --name
                              --resource-group
                              --scheduler-name
                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
examples: az durabletask taskhub create --resource-group testrg --scheduler-name testscheduler --name testtaskhub

commands.name: az durabletask taskhub delete
commands.syntax:
az durabletask taskhub delete [--ids]
                              [--name]
                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--resource-group]
                              [--scheduler-name]
                              [--subscription]
                              [--yes]
examples: az durabletask taskhub delete --resource-group testrg --scheduler-name testscheduler --name testtuskhub

commands.name: az durabletask taskhub list
examples: az durabletask taskhub list --resource-group testrg --scheduler-name testscheduler

commands.name: az durabletask taskhub show
examples: az durabletask taskhub show --resource-group testrg --scheduler-name testscheduler --name testtuskhub

commands.name: az durabletask taskhub update
commands.syntax:
az durabletask taskhub update [--add]
                              [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--ids]
                              [--name]
                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--remove]
                              [--resource-group]
                              [--scheduler-name]
                              [--set]
                              [--subscription]

commands.name: az durabletask taskhub wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
